title: Will Veigar almost always be worse than Nasus concept wise?
body:
Nasus and Veigar are both farm champs, but Nasus gets a farm lane where his scaling can destroy anyone, while Veigar gets the mid poke lane and has to pray to avoid getting an AD mid assassin.

Of course, Riot makes Veigar's stats more powerful on paper to make up for this.

replies.body: ad mid = ap jg/top and usually ap support - you will have a target.. adcs still get one shotted without being ap.
If you have stacks of course you can one shot ADCs. But what kind of support can get stacks in lane? And I've never seen Jg Veigar before.

oh. Sometimes I see all AD teams in blind pick and soloqueue though. Unfortunately, it's naturally hard to win a lane with AD mids as an AP mid in general.

Oh ik, it's like 75% more likely to get all ad then all ap or some shit :P
pretty much, everyone seems to enjoy AD champs in lower elos for some reason, especially crit based ones.

to be fair he does have range, an AoE 2 second stun and a ground targetted nuke with high base and scaling damage and a point-and-click ult that scales with the enemy's AP, true the stun and nuke are delayed but theyre not hard to land if youre not a f**king pleb.
